pageContext.claim: “We pay [Hondurus, Guatemala and El Salvador] hundreds of millions of dollars. They do nothing for us. They do nothing. They do nothing for us. They had a new one just formed in El Salvador.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has given substantial foreign aid to Central America over the last several years, but it has declined dramatically since Trump took office. All three countries were only allocated $88 million dollars in aid in 2018, down from a combined total of $499 million in 2016. All three governments are struggling with gang violence that has led to groups of people fleeing for the U.S.
